SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class OrganizerEntrantLocationTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.OrganizerEntrantLocationTest
public class OrganizerEntrantLocationTest extends Object
Unit tests for US 02.02.02: As an organizer I want to see on a map where entrants joined my event waiting list from.

These tests validate that organizers can retrieve entrant location data from Firebase and process it correctly for map display. The tests verify the ability to access waiting list data containing location information for WAITING and INVITED entrants.

    • organizer_canAccessWaitingListData_forTheirEvent

      public void organizer_canAccessWaitingListData_forTheirEvent()
      Test Case 1: Organizer can access waiting list data for their event. As an organizer, I should be able to access the waiting list data for my event, which contains entrant location information.

    • organizer_canRetrieveWaitingEntrants_withLocationData

      public void organizer_canRetrieveWaitingEntrants_withLocationData()
      Test Case 2: Organizer can retrieve entrants with location data from WAITING status. As an organizer, I should be able to retrieve entrants from the WAITING status who have location data, so I can see where they joined from.

    • organizer_canRetrieveInvitedEntrants_withLocationData

      public void organizer_canRetrieveInvitedEntrants_withLocationData()
      Test Case 3: Organizer can retrieve entrants with location data from INVITED status. As an organizer, I should be able to retrieve entrants from the INVITED status who have location data, so I can see where they joined from.

    • organizer_canAccessBothWaitingAndInvited_forLocationData

      public void organizer_canAccessBothWaitingAndInvited_forLocationData()
      Test Case 4: Organizer can access both WAITING and INVITED statuses for location data. As an organizer, I should be able to view locations from both WAITING and INVITED entrants to get a complete picture of where people joined.

    • organizer_usesCorrectEventId_whenAccessingWaitingList

      public void organizer_usesCorrectEventId_whenAccessingWaitingList()
      Test Case 5: Organizer's event ID is correctly used when accessing waiting list. As an organizer, when I access waiting list data, it should use the correct event ID to ensure I only see entrants for my event.

    • organizer_canProcessLocationData_fromEntrantSnapshots

      public void organizer_canProcessLocationData_fromEntrantSnapshots()
      Test Case 6: Organizer can process location data from entrant snapshots. As an organizer, when I retrieve entrant data, I should be able to extract latitude and longitude values for map display.

    • organizer_handlesEntrantsWithoutLocation_gracefully

      public void organizer_handlesEntrantsWithoutLocation_gracefully()
      Test Case 7: Organizer handles entrants without location data gracefully. As an organizer, when some entrants don't have location data, the system should handle this gracefully and only show entrants with valid locations.

    • organizer_canValidateLocationCoordinates

      public void organizer_canValidateLocationCoordinates()
      Test Case 8: Organizer can validate location data coordinates. As an organizer, location data should be validated to ensure coordinates are within valid ranges (latitude: -90 to 90, longitude: -180 to 180).

    • organizer_canDistinguishStatuses_forLocationDisplay

      public void organizer_canDistinguishStatuses_forLocationDisplay()
      Test Case 9: Organizer can distinguish between different entrant statuses for location display. As an organizer, I should be able to filter and view locations by entrant status (WAITING vs INVITED) to understand where different groups joined.

    • organizer_canAccessCompleteWaitingList_forMapDisplay

      public void organizer_canAccessCompleteWaitingList_forMapDisplay()
      Test Case 10: Organizer can access waiting list data for map display functionality. As an organizer, I should be able to access the complete waiting list structure needed to display entrant locations on a map, including both WAITING and INVITED statuses.
